intro: Luma filibracteata, commonly known as the Chilean fire tree, is a flowering plant native to Chile and western Argentina. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven leaflets, and it produces woody fruits that contain several seeds. Luma filibracteata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various soil types.
